body:
### Problem

I use [`multicursors.nvim`](https://github.com/smoka7/multicursors.nvim). On stable, it works fine. However, on master, it fails with an error when it uses `vim.tbl_deep_extend`. I ran git bisect (script given way below) and got the following output. The error seems to be in the transitive dependency [hydra.nvim](https://github.com/nvimtools/hydra.nvim) at [this line](https://github.com/nvimtools/hydra.nvim/blob/main/lua/hydra/layer/init.lua#L116). The bad commit in the neovim repo is [3a8811324](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/3a881132460430d23f2fdc87822c87d47f721cfc) according to the bisect.

```
Error detected while processing /home/sandy/.config/nvim/init.lua:
E5113: Error while calling lua chunk: vim/shared.lua:0: s: expected string, got number (1)
stack traceback:
	[C]: in function 'error'
	vim/shared.lua: in function 'validate'
	vim/shared.lua: in function 'startswith'
	vim/_init_packages.lua: in function '__index'
	vim/shared.lua: in function 'islist'
	vim/shared.lua: in function ''
	vim/shared.lua: in function 'tbl_deep_extend'
	...m/pack/plugins/start/hydra.nvim/lua/hydra/layer/init.lua:116: in function 'initialize'
	...im/pack/plugins/start/hydra.nvim/lua/hydra/lib/class.lua:14: in function 'Layer'
	...ig/nvim/pack/plugins/start/hydra.nvim/lua/hydra/init.lua:440: in function '_setup_pink_hydra'
	...ig/nvim/pack/plugins/start/hydra.nvim/lua/hydra/init.lua:282: in function 'initialize'
	...im/pack/plugins/start/hydra.nvim/lua/hydra/lib/class.lua:14: in function 'Hydra'
	...gins/start/multicursors.nvim/lua/multicursors/layers.lua:196: in function 'create_normal_hydra'
	...lugins/start/multicursors.nvim/lua/multicursors/init.lua:108: in function 'setup'
	/home/sandy/.config/nvim/init.lua:142: in main chunk
3a881132460430d23f2fdc87822c87d47f721cfc is the first bad commit
commit 3a881132460430d23f2fdc87822c87d47f721cfc
Author: Christian Clason <c.clason@uni-graz.at>
Date:   Sun Sep 8 18:23:46 2024 +0200

    fix(lua): revert vim.tbl_extend behavior change and document it
    
    Problem: vim.tbl_deep_extend had an undocumented feature where arrays
    (integer-indexed tables) were not merged but compared literally (used
    for merging default and user config, where one list should overwrite the
    other completely). Turns out this behavior was relied on in quite a
    number of plugins (even though it wasn't a robust solution even for that
    use case, since lists of tables (e.g., plugin specs) can be array-like
    as well).
    
    Solution: Revert the removal of this special feature. Check for
    list-like (contiguous integer indices) instead, as this is closer to the
    intent. Document this behavior.

 runtime/doc/lua.txt              |  6 ++++++
 runtime/doc/news.txt             |  3 ---
 runtime/lua/vim/shared.lua       | 13 ++++++++++++-
 test/functional/lua/vim_spec.lua |  7 +++----
 4 files changed, 21 insertions(+), 8 deletions(-)
bisect found first bad commit
```

## scripts

### bisect script
```bash
#! /usr/bin/env bash

if ! make -j$(nproc) CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release; then
  make distclean
  make clean
  make -j$(nproc) CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release
fi

# Run Neovim with your init.lua, capturing any error output
error_output=$(VIMRUNTIME=runtime ./build/bin/nvim --headless -c q 2>&1)

# Check if there was any error output
if [ -n "$error_output" ]; then
    echo "$error_output"
    exit 1
else
    exit 0
fi
```
use it like
```bash
git checkout master
git bisect start
git bisect bad
git bisect good $(git show-ref -s stable)
git bisect run bisect.sh # the script given above
```

### init.lua
```
require('multicursors').setup{}
```

### Steps to reproduce

1. Install the plugin at https://github.com/smoka7/multicursors.nvim.
2. Use the init.lua given above and open neovim
3. Lua error shows up

### Expected behavior

1. The lua error does not show up

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.11.0-dev-978+ge0a5c3bb5

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

NA

### Operating system/version

Linux 6.11.3-arch1-1

### Terminal name/version

kitty 0.36.4

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty

### Installation

build from repo in release mode

comment_data.body: That error indicates that something needs to be fixed in the plugin. Can you add a print statement to the plugin to output the offending table?

Printed them with:
```
vim.print(getfenv(), {
   vim = { o = {}, go = {}, bo = {}, wo = {} }
} )
```

Yeah, I don't think that's a usecase we want to support.
Could you tell me how to fix it in hydra? I locally submodule all my dependencies and rarely update, so I can just patch it. The error is flying over my head honestly

Honestly, I have no idea what hydra is trying to do. The hack looks very ugly and should be replaced by a saner approach. For now, revert to stable since [hydra doesn't support nightly](https://github.com/nvimtools/hydra.nvim/issues/46).
Aah, missed that issue somehow. Cool. Thanks, closing
For anyone visiting this, This is the (currently draft) PR in hydra that fixes this issue. https://github.com/nvimtools/hydra.nvim/pull/47
